intro: Biophytum lindsaeifolium, commonly known as the flame plant or fire plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking, bright red or orange inflorescences that resemble flames, which appear during the dry season. The plant has fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in arid environments. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Biophytum lindsaeifolium is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant and unique floral display.
